title: PETA's Sharp Reaction After Supreme Court's 'Remove All Stray Dogs' Order
content: The Supreme Court's sweeping order to remove all stray dogs from Delhi and the adjoining National Capital Region (NCR) has drawn a response from animal rights groups, with PETA warning that large-scale displacement is "unscientific".

title: India "Losing Trust" In Partnership With US: Amitabh Kant On Tariff Move
content: The trust built up between India and the US for over two decades is bound to b pulled down by the pejorative comments and tariff moves of US President of Donald Trump, former Niti Aayog chief and G20 Sherpa said today.

title: Drunk EasyJet Pilot Roams Naked In African Hotel's Reception, Gym, Spa
content: An EasyJet pilot was suspended after he was allegedly found drunk and naked at a luxury hotel in Africa.

title: Woman Strangles 5-Month-Old Baby Over Affair In Tripura, Arrested: Cops
content: A woman has been arrested for allegedly strangling her five-month-old daughter in Tripura's Sepahijala district, officials said Monday, making it the second such incident in the state in the last few days.

title: Trump Tariffs To Impact 55% Of Total Merchandise Exports To US: Minister
content: About 55 per cent of India's total merchandise exports to the US will be subject to 25 per cent reciprocal tariff, Minister of State for Finance Ministry Pankaj Chaudhary said on Monday.

title: Pakistan Lost Rs 4.1 Billion After Airspace Ban On Indian Flights: Report
content: Pakistan's airport body suffered a loss of Rs 4.1 billion in over two months due to the closure of airspace for Indian airlines, according to official data.

title: Dentist Kills Mother-In-Law, Chops Body Into 19 Pieces In Karnataka: Cops
content: Police cracked Lakshmi Devi murder case in Koratagere in Tumakuru and arrested her dentist son-in-law Dr Ramachandrappa S and his two accomplices.

title: Video: Elephant Startled By Tourist's Camera Flash, Chases And Tramples Him
content: In a video shared on Instagram, the elephant is seen standing on a road crowded with vehicles and people.

title: Shimla Boarding School Alumnus Kidnapped 3 Students For Extortion: Cops
content: A Bishop Cotton School (BCS) alumnus was arrested for allegedly kidnapping three school students from his alma mater for an extortion bid, police said on Monday.

title: Actor Rana Daggubati Appears Before Probe Agency In Betting App Case With 5 Years' Bank Details
content: Armed with a blue file that held bank statements for five years, actor Rana Daggubati appeared before the Enforcement Directorate's Hyderabad office in connection with the alleged online betting games promotion case Monday.

title: Video: Leopard Cub's Car Ride After Rescue In Himachal Pradesh
content: A leopard cub, around 25 days old, was rescued by a local in Himachal Pradesh. The man found the animal abandoned and vulnerable by the roadside.

title: Kapil Sharma's Security Increased In Mumbai After Attack On Canada Cafe
content: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma's security has been increased by Mumbai Police, days after a threat from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang over his ties with Salman Khan.

title: Adani Defence, Prime Aero To Acquire 100% Stake In Indamer Technics
content: Adani Defence Systems and Technologies Limited (ADSTL), in partnership with Prime Aero, on Monday signed a binding agreement to acquire a 100 per cent stake in Indamer Technics Private Limited (ITPL).

title: "Streets Must Be Safe": P Chidambaram Backs Top Court's Stray Dogs Order
content: Veteran Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP P Chidambaram has welcomed the Supreme Court's tough order to check the stray dog menace in Delhi-NCR and said the directions need to be implemented in every city across the country.

title: France's Last Newspaper Hawker To Receive Nation's Top Honour From President Macron
content: France will honour the country's last newspaper hawker, Ali Akbar, with the National Order of Merit for his decades-long service of delivering newspapers to cafes and restaurants in Paris' fashionable Latin Quarter.

title: Karnataka Minister Resigns After Voter List Remarks Upset Party, BJP Jeers
content: Karnataka minister KN Rajanna, whose remarks about the Congress voter list claims had upset the party, has resigned, sources have said.

title: Air India To Suspend Delhi-Washington Flights From September 1
content: Air India has announced that it is halting its services between Delhi and Washington, DC, from next month due to a combination of "operational factors".

title: Rajasthan Man Kills Wife, Tells Cops She Was Attacked By Robbers: Police
content: A man was detained for allegedly killing his wife in Rajasthan's Kishangarh after he reported to police that she was attacked by robbers, officials said Monday.

title: 5 Killed In Jeep-Motorcycle Collision In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: Five persons were killed and as many others injured when a jeep and a motorcycle collided in Madhya Pradesh's Anuppur district on Monday morning, police said.

title: 'Have made it clear ... ': India flags Pak army chief's nuclear threat from US soil
content: India has strongly criticized Pakistan, labeling it an irresponsible nuclear state controlled by its military, following Pak General Asim Munir's threatening remarks. Munir warned of destroying Indian infrastructure affecting water flow and issued a broader nuclear threat. India asserts Pakistan's military dominance undermines democracy and raises concerns about nuclear weapons falling into the wrong hands.

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy dials PM Modi, raises issue of oil trade with Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy conveyed to PM Modi about the ongoing Russian invasion, highlighting attacks on Ukrainian cities, including the recent shelling in Zaporizhzhia. Zelenskyy urged India to support peaceful efforts and emphasized that decisions about Ukraine must involve Ukraine's participation. Discussions also covered sanctions against Russia, particularly restricting energy exports.

title: 'Vote theft' row splits K'taka Cong: Minister contradicts Rahul; asked to quit
content: Karnataka Minister KN Rajanna criticized his own Congress party for neglecting alleged electoral roll irregularities during their governance, expressing shame over the oversights. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar rebuked Rajanna, disagreeing with his assessment, while speculation arose about Rajanna's potential resignation following his dissenting remarks on vote theft, prompting a meeting with the CM.

title: Air India to suspend nonstop Delhi-Washington flights from Sept 1
content: Air India will suspend its Delhi-Washington nonstop flights from September 1, 2025. This is due to a shortage of wide-body planes. The airline is revamping its legacy fleet. Passengers can rebook or get full refunds. The retrofit program aims to enhance customer experience. Supply chain issues have delayed the completion to October 2028.

title: Exclusive | Watching Carlsen at 2: How 5-yo Aarini became India No. 1 youngest talent
content: At just five, Delhi’s Aarini Lahoty is India’s highest-rated chess player in her age group, boasting a FIDE rating of 1551. Introduced to the game by her father-coach Surendar, Aarini began playing as a toddler and now competes in higher age categories. Balancing studies, chess, and play, she dreams of becoming India’s youngest IM and GM.

title: Microsoft CEO to employees: No longer enough to be software factory, must become…
content: Microsoft is undergoing a significant shift, transitioning from a software manufacturer to an "intelligence engine," according to CEO Satya Nadella. This transformation aims to democratize AI, empowering global users to create their own intelligent tools. Microsoft will focus on building AI systems that enable individuals and organizations to develop customized solutions, redesigning its technology stack to support this new vision.

title: New I-T Bill passes Lok Sabha: What are top suggestions being included?
content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman  tabled the revised New Income Tax Bill 2025 in Parliament. This followed the withdrawal of the original bill. The new version incorporates recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee.

title: 'Rohit itna marega na tereko': Yuvraj warns content creator - Watch
content: Yuvraj Singh jokingly warns a content creator who mimics Rohit Sharma. The mimic is popular for his impressions. Rohit Sharma recently bought a Lamborghini Urus SE. The car has a personalized number plate. It reflects his children's birthdays and jersey number. Rohit last played in IPL 2025. India's ODI series against Bangladesh is cancelled. His next challenge is in Australia.

title: 'Liberation Day in DC': Trump declares he will end violence in US Capital
content: President Trump declared a "liberation day" for Washington, D.C., vowing to eliminate crime and filth while promising to restore the capital to its former glory. He announced a "crime and beautification" plan, increasing federal patrols and criticizing wasteful spending on projects like the Federal Reserve renovation.

title: Trump asks Intel CEO to resign: Former directors call for a new company, say ‘Only a dramatic…’
content: Amidst security concerns over CEO Lip-Bu Tan's China ties, four former Intel board members are advocating for a radical restructuring. They propose spinning off Intel's manufacturing arm into an independent entity to bolster America's chipmaking capabilities. This move aims to rival TSMC and address national security needs, especially after Intel received significant CHIPS Act funding.

title: Move over Dhoni! Ex-India captain declares who is World No. 1
content: Mohammad Azharuddin praised Syed Kirmani as the world's best wicketkeeper, highlighting his skills against spin and contribution to India's 1983 World Cup victory, at the launch of Kirmani's autobiography. Azharuddin also commended Mohammad Siraj for his outstanding performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker.

title: J&K: BSF troops shoot and injure ‘Pakistani intruder' in Kathua district
content: Border Security Force (BSF) troops shot and injured a Pakistani intruder along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district on Monday. The intruder was part of a group attempting to infiltrate Indian territory near the Hiranagar sector. Alert BSF personnel noticed the group and issued repeated warnings, which were ignored, leading to the firing.

title: Bloating is not normal: How enzyme-based supplements can help reduce water retention
content: Feeling bloated after meals is a common issue, often dismissed as normal, but it signals digestive overload. This occurs when food isn't fully broken down, leading to fermentation and gas. Enzyme-based supplements can aid digestion by breaking down complex foods, improving nutrient absorption, and supporting gut balance, ultimately preventing bloating and promoting overall digestive health.

title: Former Tesla Dojo lead Ganesh Venkataramanan: Launches DensityAI; revolutionising car AI systems
content: Ganesh Venkataramanan, previously with Tesla's Dojo, has launched DensityAI. The startup aims to transform self-driving car AI development. DensityAI focuses on a full-stack AI platform for autonomous vehicles. It addresses computational and data demands. The company seeks to streamline AI training and deployment for automakers. DensityAI plans to expand into robotics.

title: Rohit Sharma's new Lamborghini car has the number 3015 - Here's why
content: Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has acquired a striking red Lamborghini Urus SE in Mumbai, featuring a personalized '3015' number plate. This number cleverly combines his children's birthdays and links to his iconic jersey number, 45. The high-performance Urus SE, priced at Rs 4.57 crore, boasts impressive speed and power.

title: Pigeon feeding row: Jain monk says 'will take up arms if needed'
content: Jain monk Muni Nileshchandra Vijay is threatening a hunger strike starting August 13 over the closure of Dadar Kabutarkhana, a traditional pigeon-feeding site. The BMC closed the area citing health concerns, leading to clashes. Vijay alleges political motivation and vows defiance, even against court orders, claiming widespread Jain support.

title: Mahomes gets family, brother Jackson’s support after preseason benching
content: Patrick Mahomes, despite limited playtime in the preseason game against the Cardinals, demonstrated his readiness and leadership. After a brief appearance that included a touchdown pass, Mahomes shifted to a supportive role, advising teammates and offering insights to the coaching staff. Coach Reid praised Mahomes' leadership, emphasizing his importance to the team's Super Bowl aspirations.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Taylor Swift on going public with Travis Kelce: 'Proud of each other'
content: Taylor Swift openly embraced her relationship with Travis Kelce, contrasting sharply with her past privacy, particularly with Joe Alwyn. Swift explained to TIME that they proudly support each other, dismissing the need to hide their romance. Since 2023, they've been publicly affectionate, attending events and date nights, fueling engagement speculations.

title: Alex Ovechkin speaks out: Why he won't join NHL with son Sergei
content: Alex Ovechkin, the NHL's top goal scorer, has dismissed the possibility of playing professionally with his son, Sergei, despite the six-year-old's impressive performance at a recent event in Moscow. Ovechkin humorously noted his age would prevent such a pairing. While a father-son NHL duo won't happen, Ovechkin's sons are showing hockey talent, potentially continuing the family's legacy in the sport.

title: 'Want answers, not attacks': Tharoor backs Rahul's 'vote theft' claims; joins INDIA bloc protest
content: Shashi Tharoor criticised the Election Commission for allegedly attacking Rahul Gandhi instead of addressing serious concerns about electoral integrity. Tharoor emphasised that the EC should prioritise clearing doubts about potential voter list manipulation and vote theft, rather than focusing on procedural formalities like demanding an oath or affidavit from Rahul Gandhi.

title: Watch: Chinese vessels collide on South China Sea while chasing boat
content: Tensions escalate in the South China Sea as a Chinese navy vessel collides with a Chinese coast guard ship during a chase of a Philippine patrol boat near Scarborough Shoal. The Philippine coast guard released video footage of the incident, which occurred during a humanitarian mission. Philippine President Marcos affirmed continued presence in the area to assert Manila's sovereign rights.

title: Magic Johnson & Wife Cookie share heartfelt moment honouring Lakers legend’s mother
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his mother, Christine Johnson's, 90th birthday with a heartfelt party alongside his wife, Cookie, and their children. The event, filled with love and appreciation, honored Christine's life dedicated to the Lord. Gospel artist Tamela Mann surprised Christine with a performance, making the celebration even more special at Breslin Arena.

title: 'Global Sumud Flotilla': Greta Thunberg plans second Gaza aid voyage
content: Greta Thunberg announced a second, larger flotilla mission to deliver aid to Gaza, launching from Spain on August 31st with activists from 44 countries. The "Global Sumud Flotilla" includes multiple ships and aims to break the Israeli blockade, despite previous attempts being intercepted.

title: Fans defend Halle Berry after David Justice says he left because she "didn't cook or clean"
content: Halle Berry's fans are defending her after ex-husband David Justice's recent interview, where he claimed he left their marriage due to her not fitting his traditional expectations of a wife. Justice stated he desired a partner who cooked, cleaned, and embodied a strong maternal role, suggesting counseling might have altered their outcome.

title: LS passes sports bill; Mandaviya calls it biggest sports reform since Independence
content: India's sports sector is set for a major overhaul with the passage of the National Sports Governance Bill and the National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill. Sports Minister Mandaviya hailed the governance bill as the most significant reform since independence, aiming for accountability and transparency in sports federations. The anti-doping bill addresses WADA's concerns, ensuring NADA's independence.

title: Kapil Sharma gets tight security from Mumbai Police after firing at his café in Canada
content: Following two shooting incidents outside Kapil Sharma's Canada café, Mumbai Police have heightened security for the comedian and his family. The increased protection comes after Salman Khan's appearance on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show,' reportedly drawing the ire of the Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate.

title: Oppn MPs’ march to EC: Akhilesh jumps barricade; Rahul detained – Key points
content: Opposition leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, marched to the Election Commission to protest alleged voter fraud and irregularities in Bihar's electoral roll revision. Delhi Police halted the march, leading to dramatic scenes of leaders climbing barricades.

title: Bite marks, beatings: Nanny who brutalised toddler had no training
content: In Noida, a 15-month-old baby was allegedly tortured at a daycare center by a 16-year-old attendant, who bit her thighs and inflicted other injuries. The parents discovered the abuse after noticing bite marks and viewing CCTV footage that revealed the extent of the violence.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife: 1st descendant of enslaved Africans to gain Benin citizenship
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Justin Rose makes history, becomes PGA Tour’s oldest European winner
content: Justin Rose, at 45, defied age-related expectations with a remarkable comeback at the St. Jude Championship, securing victory in a tense playoff. His stellar performance, including six back-nine birdies, not only marked him as the PGA Tour's oldest European winner in the modern era but also propelled him up the FedEx Cup standings.

title: Nasa engineer unveils Taylor Swift's billion-dollar secret to success
content: Taylor Swift's ascent to global superstardom is attributed to strategic empire-building beyond music, as analyzed by a NASA engineer. Swift has cultivated a loyal fanbase through immersive experiences and reclaimed ownership of her music, disrupting industry norms. Her relentless work ethic and strategic decisions have propelled her into a powerful figure, offering a blueprint for success in any field.

title: Independence Day '25: Is it India's 78th or 79th Independence Day? All you need to know
content: India gears up to celebrate its 79th Independence Day in 2025, commemorating the nation's freedom from British rule. The celebrations will include flag hoisting, patriotic songs, and events promoting national unity, especially among the youth. The Prime Minister's address at the Red Fort will follow traditional protocols, honoring the sacrifices of freedom fighters and celebrating India's heritage.

title: Amid speculation over India future, here’s when Kohli last played a List A match
content: Speculation surrounds Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI futures as the BCCI contemplates their roles. With the Bangladesh series canceled, their next potential ODI appearance is against Australia in October. A proposal suggests they gain match practice in India A games against Australia A before the series, raising questions about their readiness and future in the format.

title: 'Ensures representation': MHA defends LG's nominations to J&K assembly; submits affidavit to HC
content: The Home Ministry defended the LG's power to nominate assembly members in J&K, citing inclusivity. This came in response to a Congress leader's challenge to the Reorganisation Act. The ministry argued the nominations ensure representation for displaced communities and women. Mehbooba Mufti criticised the move as undemocratic, urging opposition to this precedent.

title: Nagpur: Man rides 80km with wife’s body tied to bike after fatal highway crash
content: Following a tragic road accident on the Nagpur-Madhya Pradesh highway, a man was compelled to transport his wife's body home on his motorcycle due to the absence of immediate assistance. The incident occurred near Deolapar, where an unidentified vehicle struck their motorcycle, resulting in the woman's death.

title: ‘Issue complicated’: After India tariff, will Trump target China? US VP replies
content: Donald Trump is considering tariffs on China for Russian oil imports. This follows a 25% tariff imposed on India for similar purchases. Vice President J D Vance notes the US-China relationship is complex.

title: NBA hall of famer Allen Iverson’s emotional message for Carmelo Anthony
content: NBA legend Carmelo Anthony chose Allen Iverson and Dwyane Wade for his Hall of Fame induction. The ceremony is scheduled for September 6, 2025. Iverson expressed his honor on Instagram, recalling their Nuggets days. Anthony will also join NBC Sports and Peacock as a studio analyst. He will share his NBA insights starting in the 2025-26 season.

title: Ranya Rao's father K Ramachandra Rao reappointed as DGP; posts in civil rights dept
content: The Karnataka government has reinstated IPS officer Dr. K Ramachandra Rao as DGP after his compulsory leave due to a gold smuggling investigation involving his daughter, Ranya Rao. Ranya was arrested for allegedly smuggling 14.2kg of gold from Dubai.

title: Bihar: After ‘Dog Babu’, ‘Cat Kumar’ surfaces; mother's name listed as ‘Catiya Devi’
content: Authorities in Bihar's Rohtas district are investigating a bizarre incident where an application for a residential certificate was filed under the name "Cat Kumar," son of "Catty Boss" and "Catiya Devi," complete with a canine's photograph. This incident follows a similar case in Patna’s Masaurhi block, where a residence certificate was issued to a dog. A formal case has been registered.

title: ODI WC trophy unveiled: Harmanpreet Kaur eyes ICC glory for India
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed her team's determination to win the upcoming ODI Women’s World Cup on home soil, aiming to end India's long wait for an ICC women’s title. She acknowledged the pressure but highlighted the motivation it provides, drawing inspiration from Yuvraj Singh.

title: FASTag annual pass: Rs 3,000 for 200 trips – How to get by Aug 15, 2025
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, offering private vehicle owners a prepaid plan of 200 toll crossings or one year of validity for Rs 3,000. This initiative aims to streamline toll payments and reduce the need for frequent recharges on national highways and expressways, enhancing the travel experience.

title: 'They will lose to India’: Ex-cricketer doubts Aus & SA’s WTC final chances
content: Aakash Chopra suggested that both Australia and South Africa, the finalists of the previous WTC cycle, might face difficulties in reaching the 2027 final. Despite Australia's strong start, their tour of India and an aging bowling attack could hinder their progress. South Africa's challenging away series in the subcontinent also diminish their chances of qualifying, according to Chopra.

title: ‘They are financially strong ...’: Gadkari’s veiled ‘dadagiri’ jibe amid Trump tariffs
content: Nitin Gadkari indirectly criticised US President Donald Trump's tariff policies, asserting that financial strength and technological advancement shouldn't lead to bullying. He emphasised India's commitment to its culture of global welfare, even with economic growth. Gadkari also highlighted the importance of innovation and research to boost India's economic growth and self-reliance.

title: UFC moving to Paramount in '26 with 7-year deal
content: Paramount will become the new home to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S. under a seven-year agreement with TKO Group.

title: Eagles' Dickerson injured in practice, exits on cart
content: Eagles Pro Bowl left guard Landon Dickerson was helped off the field and carted indoors after suffering an apparent right leg injury during the team's open practice Sunday night.

title: Aces' Wilson first with 30-point, 20-rebound game
content: A'ja Wilson had 32 points and 20 rebounds, becoming the first player in WNBA history with 30-plus points and at least 20 rebounds in a game.

title: Rose rallies late, tops Spaun in St. Jude playoff
content: Justin Rose made up a three-shot deficit over the last five holes against hard-luck Tommy Fleetwood, and then made two birdies in a playoff against U.S. Open champion J.J. Spaun to win the FedEx St. Jude Championship on Sunday.

title: Raleigh clubs MLB-best 45th HR in Mariners' win
content: Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 45th home run in a four-run first inning, and Seattle hung on for a 6-3 victory over Tampa Bay on Sunday.

title: Bills delivers Pennsylvania first LLSWS since '78
content: Behind Reagan Bills' two-way heroics, Johnstown, Pennsylvania, defeated Floyds Knobs, Indiana, 1-0 on Sunday to win the state's first Little League Softball World Series since 1978.

title: Olympian Rivera, 17, wins at U.S. championships
content: Hezly Rivera, a 17-year-old Olympic gold medalist, pulled away for a victory at the U.S. gymnastics championships Sunday.

title: With Messi out, Orlando drops Miami to 6th in rout
content: Luis Muriel scored a goal in each half and Martín Ojeda had a goal and an assist to lead Orlando City to a 4-1 victory over Inter Miami on Sunday night.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Where the NBA's biggest remaining free agents stand this offseason
content: The futures of Jonathan Kuminga, Josh Giddey and others remain in flux as the 2025-26 season draws closer.

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Orlovsky ranks the best NFL QBs in seven different traits: Who makes each top-10 list?
content: Which NFL quarterbacks have the strongest arms, greatest accuracy and best rushing ability? Dan Orlovsky stacked the 10 best in seven skill areas.

title: The bloody life of a UFC Octagon
content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

title: Matthew and Brady Tkachuk on Olympic gold, Canada rivalry and new NHL CBA
content: What's it like being on the cover of a video game with their dad? And what are their thoughts on the Winter Games?

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Ranked: The top 50 players going into the new Premier League season﻿
content: Ahead of the 2025-26 Premier League season, let's rank the best 50 players to keep an eye on. Liverpool and Arsenal dominate the list, but Man United managed some spots, too.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Donnarumma available for low transfer fee
content: Paris Saint-Germain have made goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma available for a knockdown transfer fee. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins fourth race this season
content: Shane van Gisbergen tied a Cup Series record with his fourth straight road-course victory, blowing out the competition again at Watkins Glen International.

title: 🏈 Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: 🏆 Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: 🏀 Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: 🏈 ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: 🧂 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: 👊 Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Dean Burmester wins LIV Chicago in three-way playoff
content: Dean Burmester beat Jon Rahm and Josele Ballester in a three-way playoff Sunday to win LIV Golf Chicago.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Boat clubs in central Travancore shift to race mode ahead of season
content: Four teams from Kottayam and Pathanamthitta districts will compete in Nehru Trophy Boat Race. Several clubs, however, are keeping off races citing huge financial constraints

title: Andhra Pradesh eases industrial norms, halves parking mandate to woo investors
content: State streamlines regulations by relaxing setbacks, removing minimum plot size limits, and encouraging vertical development to reduce compliance costs, expedite project clearances, and enhance MSME competitiveness

title: Bihar SIR: BJP accuses Opposition of attempting to create anarchy for political gain
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticised the Opposition for attacking the ECI without any evidence, and alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was using the ‘language of rival countries’

title: Vote theft: Chamaraja MLA for examining voters’ list of the constituency
content: Gowda says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has placed the issue of vote theft with evidence before the people of the country, and a complaint in this regard will also be given to the Election Commission

title: Minister reviews flood situation in Vijayapura, asks officers to take up relief measures
content: M.B. Patil tells officials to take precautionary measures to prevent flood damage in urban areas of the district

title: Collateral-free shrimp crop loan scheme launched in A.P.
content: Under the APGB–AquaExchange agreement, ₹25 crore worth of collateral-free crop loans will be disbursed to around 100 shrimp farmers over the next 3 to 6 months

title: Nainar Nagenthran flays DMK government for ‘stopping’ distribution of free textbooks to Tamil Associations outside State
content: He alleges that it has splurged crores on empty advertisements and now cites a lack of funds as a reason for its decision

title: Take up work on delimitation of wards in urban local bodies as per 2011 census: Mandya DC
content: The tenure of municipalities of Maddur, Malavalli, and Pandavapura will end on October 23; K.R. Pet on October 31; Bellur Town Panchayat on November 4; Nagamangala and Srirangapatna municipalities on November 5 and 6 respectively; while the term of Mandya City Municipal Council will conclude on November 2

title: Farmers hold ‘motorcycle protest marches’ against Punjab’s land pooling policy
content: Demanding the immediate withdrawal of the policy under the banner of the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, protestors warned the government of an intensified agitation if its wasn’t

title: BJP has won trust of all sections of society, says Madhav
content: State BJP chief lauds Modi’s inclusive governance, cites welfare schemes and national security initiatives; vows to push for completion of Handri–Neeva project

title: Bommai sees need for apolitical struggle to get Bedti-Varada river linking project launched
content: The BJP MP tells a preliminary meeting on the river linking project in Haveri that the Centre has agreed to consider the demand for it positively

title: Pakistani intruder shot at, arrested by BSF troops along International Border in J&K's Kathua
content: The injured intruder was arrested and immediately shifted to a hospital for treatment, the officials said, adding his identity and the motive behind his abortive attempt to infiltrate into this side was matter of further investigation.

title: Eluru MP takes up farmers’ issues, key infrastructure projects with Prime Minister
content: Putta Mahesh Kumar presses for palm oil pricing, tobacco procurement reforms, and expedited railway and bridge works during Parliament meeting

title: ‘Less said, the better’ about Tambaram Police Commissionerate, says Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh directs it to pay rental arrears of ₹2.18 crore to its landlords and vacate the property within two years

title: 25,000 tonnes of fertilizers in stock, no urea shortage in Mandya: DC
content: Deputy Commissioner instructs officials to create awareness among farmers on using NPK complex fertilizers instead of urea during transplantation

title: Let us work for a drug-free Thoothukudi, Minister urges people
content: Geetha Jeevan urges students stay alert and inform the authorities if they come across any signs of drug peddling in their vicinity

title: P-4 initiative purely voluntary; no quotas for officials or departments, says Foundation Vice-Chairman
content: Kutumba Rao says the Public-Private-People Partnership is a non-political, inclusive movement focused on eradicating poverty and empowering citizens across Andhra Pradesh

title: Pigeon feeding row: Jain monk warns of stir from August 13, says will take up arms if needed
content: Jain monk threatens hunger strike over pigeon feeding ban, Maharashtra minister distances himself from controversial comments

title: On board Bengaluru’s Namma Metro Yellow line on day 1: Quicker commute, longer wait time
content: The Hindu team boarded the early-morning train on the first day of operations of the much-awaited Yellow Line from RV Road to Delta Electronics Bommasandra on Monday, and experienced a faster ride, but packed coaches, long waits, and a glaring shortage of trains.

title: Air India to suspend Delhi-Washington D.C. flights due to shortage of Dreamliners, other factors
content: Air India said the suspension is driven by its initiative to upgrade the avionics and other critical components of its 26 legacy B787-8 Dreamliner aircraft to reduce operational disruptions

title: State-of-the-art Radiology unit brings affordable diagnostics to Alappuzha
content: 3,600 people have undergone MRI and CT scans at newly launched Radiology unit of Alappuzha GH in seven months.  An MRI scan costing ₹6,000 at private hospitals is done at ₹2,500 at GH

title: Rajya Sabha returns Manipur budget, GST bill
content: Opposition MPs, many of whom were in the Well of the House, were heard saying “no” as voting on the Bill was going on

title: Union Minister Suresh Gopi counters critics with social media post
content: Suresh Gopi posts photos on his social media handle showing himself holding official meeting amid allegations from political opponents in Kerala that he has been absent from his constituency for some time

title: Parliament passes bill to provide reservation to Scheduled Tribes in Goa Assembly
content: Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal moved 'The Readjustment of Representation of Scheduled Tribes in Assembly Constituencies of the State of Goa Bill, 2025' for consideration

title: AIADMK will face the worst rout in western Tamil Nadu: CM Stalin
content: According to Mr. Stalin, since the DMK government has performed remarkably well in the western districts, the AIADMK will suffer its worst defeat in the region

title: Kerala has set a model for the country in Ayurveda treatment, says Health Minister
content: Veena George inaugurates newly constructed women’s hostel building and open-air stage at Government Ayurveda College, Pariyaram, Kannur

title: TVK chief Vijay condemns detention of Opposition MPs in Delhi
content: Mr. Vijay also reiterated his party’s stance of advocating for free and fair elections to safeguard democracy

title: Karnataka Minister K.N. Rajanna resigns after his remarks on ‘vote theft’
content: The minister had sparked a row by saying that irregularities in the electoral rolls occurred while the Congress was in power

title: India sees normal monsoon rainfall; some States drenched, others parched
content: Between June 1 and August 10, the country recorded 539 mm of rain against a normal of 535.6 mm, about 1% above the long-period average

title: US tariff hike will hit Kerala’s exports hard, State to study crisis in depth: CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi points out that US is the second largest importer of agricultural products from Kerala, accounting for more than 20% of State’s exports of cashew nut, rice, vegetables, processed fruits and cereal flours

title: Giani Harpreet Singh elected president of SAD breakaway faction
content: The Akal Takht-appointed committee held the delegate session of the breakaway group of the SAD at Gurdwara Burj Akali Phoola Singh in Amritsar.

title: Fire breaks out in basement of Navi Mumbai hospital; all patients safely evacuated
content: According to fire service officials, the incident was reported at 12 noon on August 11 in a medical facility in Sector 6.

title: Uber launches India’s first dedicated Uber Black pickup zone at Bengaluru airport
content: The initiative, launched on August 11, is aimed at offering a seamless transition between air and ground travel, according to Uber

title: More than 40 arrests made under anti-poaching exercise in Assam, says video shared by CM Himanta Biswa Sharma
content: “Poachers have been chased, using all available resources, from on-ground to digital intelligence,” Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Asim Munir’s remarks ‘reinforce well-held doubts’ about Pakistan’s nuclear command, says India
content: “The international community can draw its own conclusions on the irresponsibility inherent in such remarks, which also reinforce the well-held doubts about the integrity of nuclear command and control in a state where the military is hand-in-glove with terrorist groups,” the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Watch: Chennai sanitation workers protest privatisation, demand permanent jobs
content: For decades, Chennai’s conservancy workers have kept the city clean, often without recognition or job security. Now, facing job losses due to a sweeping privatisation move by the Greater Chennai Corporation, nearly 2,000 workers are rising in protest, demanding permanency. As garbage piles up and political pressure mounts, the city is at a crossroads in its battle over dignity, livelihood, and public sanitation.

title: Third edition of Vaidya Vishwakosha, encyclopaedia on medicine in Kannada, released in Kalaburagi
content: Minister for Medical Education Dr. Sharan Prakash Patil, who released the 875-page volume, described the work as an extraordinary and challenging achievement

title: Air India flight diverted to Chennai: DGCA rejects MP Venugopal’s claim
content: DGCA responds with a detailed statement rejecting Congress MP K.C. Venugopal’s claim that the Air India flight’s landing was aborted as ‘another aircraft was on the runway’

title: Kerala govt clears boat purchase for Haritha Karma Sena in Kainakary to collect non-biodegradable waste
content: In eight of the 15 wards in the panchayat, waterways are the primary means of travel. At present, waste collection is carried out using a rented boat, which costs ₹27,000 per month

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Revised Income Tax Bill introduced and passed in Lok Sabha without debate
content: The Select Committee, chaired by Baijayant Panda, had suggested a host of changes in the Income-tax Bill, 2025, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on February 13

title: Opposition protests well thought out strategy to create anarchy, instability: BJP
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan termed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s allegation of “vote theft” against the ruling BJP and the Election Commission a “lie” and said the Congress has been resorting to such tactics as it has no other issues to raise

title: Karnataka witnessed five-fold jump in GST tax evasion at ₹39,577 cr in FY25, Lok Sabha informed
content: In a written reply in the Lok Sabha, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said “Central GST authorities have not issued any notices based on UPI transaction”.

title: Sun TV share dispute: ‘Dayanidhi Maran’s legal notice against brother Kalanithi withdrawn, issues resolved’
content: In June, a truce was called and a mediation between the Maran brothers took place in the presence of key members of the DMK family, including Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

title: India on U.K.’s ‘Deport Now Appeal Later’ expanded list for foreign criminals
content: India will be added along with Angola, Australia, Botswana, Brunei, Bulgaria, Canada, Guyana, Indonesia, Kenya, Latvia, Lebanon, Malaysia, Uganda, and Zambia

title: Rajasthan HC extends Asaram's interim bail
content: The relief came after a recent extension of his interim bail by Gujarat High court in a similar case till August 21

title: Ranya Rao case: DGP Ramachandra Rao re-appointed
content: Ramachandra Rao has been posted as Director General of Police, Directorate of Civil Rights Enforcement

title: Kerala’s public health sector under attack from corporate hospital lobbies, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi says multinational companies are making large-scale investments in private healthcare with the primary aim of maximising returns

title: No proposal under consideration for restoration of Old Pension Scheme: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Centre had moved away from OPS due to its unsustainable fiscal liability on the government exchequer, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in a reply in the Lok Sabha.

title: Kerala young woman’s death takes a twist; friend arrested for abetment to suicide, sexual abuse
content: Initially, Kothamangalam police registered a case of unnatural death. However, police have stumbled upon a suicide note, reportedly written by the deceased

title: Google vs CCI: What the Android antitrust case means for India’s digital ecosystem
content: The case raises fundamental questions about how much control a dominant platform like Android should have over the devices and services it supports, and to what extent regulators can intervene in the name of competition.

title: Minor girl in Odisha dies after self-immolation
content: She was first rushed to a private hospital and later referred to Veer Surendra Sai Institute of Medical Sciences and Research, Burla. The girl died during treatment at Burla

title: ₹100-crore defamation suit filed by M.S. Dhoni | Madras High Court orders commencement of trial
content: Justice C.V. Karthikeyan appoints an advocate commissioner to record the evidence of the cricketer in Chennai between October 20 and December 10, 2025

title: A.P. Home Minister Anitha directs officials to be on alert following IMD’s heavy rain forecast
content: Ms. Anitha directed the Collectors, Superintendents of Police and the A.P. State Disaster Management Authority officials to be alert and take steps to prevent human loss.

title: Rahul Gandhi demands clean, pure voter list; says ‘vote theft’ issue will explode soon
content: Rahul Gandhi was briefly detained along with others as police stopped the protest march by opposition MPs from Parliament House to the EC office

title: A.P. Governor to launch Red Cross Society’s campaign against single-use plastics on August 12
content: 70 schools to receive the first batch of cloth bags on a pilot basis as part of the campaign, says IRCS State branch and convenor of the campaign

title: Supreme Court strikes down Army’s policy restricting women officers’ appointment to Judge Advocate General posts
content: “The Executive cannot restrict numbers and/or make reservation for male officers under the guise of induction by way of policy or administrative instructions,” Supreme Court observed

title: Chennai Corporation conservancy workers’ protest: Madras High Court to hear writ petition on August 13
content: Justice K. Surender adjourns the matter after Advocate General P.S. Raman says he intends to file a fresh counter affidavit on behalf of the Corporation Commissioner

title: Minister Kondapalli urges entrepreneurs to be part of A.P. govt.’s P-4 programme
content: Nearly 20 lakh marginalised families would be covered under the A.P. govt.’s P4 programme and they would be called as golden families under the programme, says Minister Kondapalli Srinivas

title: Tourist’s misadventure with elephant in Bandipur turns into heart-stopping moment on camera
content: This incident has brought into focus the recurring problem of tourists disregarding safety advisories to venture close to wild animals in forests

title: Kerala Governor’s directive on ‘Partition Horror Day’ sparks political controversy
content: Official email from Kerala Raj Bhavan instructed universities to organise seminars and commemorative events, including street plays and dramas highlighting ‘the trauma of India’s partition’

title: ‘Voter fraud’ allegations: Surjewala accuses Election Commission for ‘lame duck’ excuses
content: Randeep Singh Surjewala’s remarks came after the Haryana Chief Electoral Officer asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to furnish documents within 10 days in support of his claims about anomalies in electoral rolls in the 2024 State Assembly polls

title: Suneetha Narreddy writes open letter seeking reopening of probe into her father’s murder
content: Daughter of slain MP Y.S. Vivekananda Reddy alleges political interference, says masterminds remain free six years after killing

title: Rahul Gandhi, other leaders stopped, detained as Opposition takes out protest march against Bihar SIR, ‘vote chori’
content: As the MPs were stopped, many of them sat on the road and raised slogans while some climbed the barricades. They were whisked away by police and taken to the Parliament Street Police Station and later released.

title: Supreme Court confirms Medha Patkar’s conviction in criminal defamation case by Delhi L-G Saxena
content: A Bench of Justices however set aside an order directing Ms. Patkar, represented by senior advocate Sanjay Parikh and advocate Abhimanue Shreshta, to pay ₹1 lakh in compensation

title: Both Houses adjourned till 2 p.m. as Opposition firm on discussion on Bihar SIR
content: Opposition has been demanding a discussion on the SIR exercise initiated by the Election Commission ahead of the Bihar assembly elections due later this year

title: Criminal killed in police firing in Jharkhand
content: According to police, Surya Narayan Hansda alias Surya Hansda, was wanted in several criminal cases in Jharkhand's Godda and Sahibganj districts

title: Samajwadi Party MLAs protest on Assembly premises ahead of Uttar Pradesh Monsoon session
content: Carrying banners, posters and placards in their hands, the MLAs of Samajwadi Party gathered near the statue of Chaudhary Charan Singh on the Assembly premises and raised anti-government slogans

title: BJP has turned ECI into its ‘poll-rigging machinery’, alleges T.N. CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleged that what happened in Bengaluru’s Mahadevapura was “not an administrative lapse,” but “a calculated conspiracy to steal the people’s mandate.”

title: 'Fight for One Man, One Vote': Rahul after stir near EC HQ; refuses to sign oath
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: How will Yankees manage busy bullpen?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the baseball team defended their home turf on friday, then the Cubs captured yesterday's tilt . a left oblique strain was scratched from today's start and was placed on the 15-day IL with a . left strain .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Tyler Shough's debut a mixed bag for Saints
content: the 2025 preseason kicked off Thursday and continued through Sunday . several rookies played their first snaps, whether they were rookies or offseason acquisitions . quarterback jamaree Caldwell has shown why the Chargers selected him .

title: Defensive frailties dog Liverpool, but new signings show quality
content: Crystal Palace drew 2-2 with a 3-2 penalty shootout win at wembley on sunday . the win was the second in a matter of months for the premier league champions . it was their opponents' second win of the season after 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united .

title: Projecting the top 10 freshmen for the 2025 season
content: the start of the college football season is approaching . many true freshmen are battling for roles -- or even starting spots -- on their teams . it didn't take long for Jeremiah Smith and Ryan Williams to establish themselves as difference-makers .

title: 🏈 Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .

title: NFL Future Power Rankings: We stacked all 32 teams' long-term expectations
content: in our annual Future Power Rankings, we ranked which teams are primed to be among the league's best over the next three seasons (2025 through 2027) each of the four categories was weighted to create the overall score: quarterback (20%), roster (30%), front office (25%) and coaching (25%). the results are based on how well each team is positioned for the future.
